info.title: EmailEngine API
info.description:
EmailEngine provides a RESTful API for managing email accounts, sending messages, and processing email data across multiple providers.

Authentication

All API requests require authentication using an Access Token. You can generate and manage your tokens from the Access Tokens page. Include your token in requests using one of these methods: - Query parameter: ?access_token=YOUR_TOKEN - Authorization header: Authorization: Bearer YOUR_TOKEN

Request Processing

Sequential Processing: Requests to the same email account are processed sequentially to maintain data consistency. Multiple simultaneous requests will be queued. Timeouts: Long-running operations may cause queued requests to timeout. Configure appropriate timeout values using the X-EE-Timeout header (in milliseconds).

Getting Started

1. Generate an Access Token 2. Add an email account 3. Start making API requests using the endpoints below

tags.name: Account
tags.description: Manage email accounts, including IMAP/SMTP configuration, OAuth2 authentication, and account health monitoring

tags.name: Mailbox
tags.description: List, create, modify, and manage mailbox folders. Retrieve folder statistics and special-use designations

tags.name: Message
tags.description: Search, retrieve, update, and delete email messages. Manage flags, labels, and message content

tags.name: Submit
tags.description: Send emails with attachments, reply to threads, forward messages, and upload to folders. Supports both immediate and scheduled sending

tags.name: Outbox
tags.description: Monitor and manage the email sending queue. View pending messages, retry failed deliveries, and track sending progress

tags.name: Delivery Test
tags.description: Test email deliverability and authentication. Verify SPF, DKIM signatures, DMARC alignment, and analyze potential delivery issues

tags.name: Access Tokens
tags.description: Create and manage API access tokens with customizable permissions, IP restrictions, and rate limits

tags.name: Settings
tags.description: Configure EmailEngine runtime settings including webhooks, tracking, AI features, and email processing options

tags.name: Templates
tags.description: Create and manage reusable email templates with variable substitution, HTML/text content, and attachments

tags.name: Logs
tags.description: Access system and account-level logs for debugging, monitoring, and audit purposes

tags.name: Stats
tags.description: Retrieve usage statistics, performance metrics, and account activity data

tags.name: License
tags.description: Manage EmailEngine licensing, view license status, and handle license-related operations

tags.name: Webhooks
tags.description: Configure webhook endpoints, manage event subscriptions, and monitor webhook delivery status

tags.name: OAuth2 Applications
tags.description: Configure OAuth2 applications for Gmail, Outlook, and other providers. Manage client credentials and authentication flows

tags.name: SMTP Gateway
tags.description: Configure and manage the built-in SMTP server for receiving emails and integrating with external systems

tags.name: Blocklists
tags.description: Manage email address blocklists to prevent sending to specific recipients or domains

tags.name: Multi Message Actions
tags.description: Perform bulk operations on multiple messages simultaneously, such as marking as read, moving, or deleting

servers.description: Your EmailEngine server (replace with your actual server URL)

AccountCountersEvents.description: Cumulative event counters for the account lifetime

response.description: Raw error response from the OAuth2 server

tokenRequest.description: Details about the failed OAuth2 token request

status.description: HTTP status code from the OAuth2 server

clientId.description: OAuth2 client ID used for authentication

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

email.description: Default email address of the account

proxy.description: Proxy server URL for outbound connections

smtpEhloName.description: Hostname to use in SMTP EHLO/HELO commands (defaults to system hostname)

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 993
Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 993

count.description: Count of blocked addresses in this list

deliveries.description: Count of email deliveries using this gateway

licensedTo.description: Organization or individual the license is issued to

active.description: Whether a valid license is currently active

suspended.description: Whether email operations are suspended due to license issues

googleTopicName.description: Google Pub/Sub topic name for Gmail push notifications

legacy.description: `true` for older OAuth2 apps set via the settings endpoint

created.description: The time this entry was added

updated.description: The time this entry was updated

includeInListing.description: Is the application listed in the hosted authentication form

clientId.description: Client or Application ID for 3-legged OAuth2 applications

clientSecret.description: Client secret for 3-legged OAuth2 applications. Actual value is not revealed.

authority.description: Authorization tenant value for Outlook OAuth2 applications

serviceClient.description: Service client ID for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

googleWorkspaceAccounts.description: Restrict OAuth2 login to Google Workspace accounts only

serviceClientEmail.description: Service Client Email for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceKey.description: PEM formatted service secret for 2-legged OAuth2 applications. Actual value is not revealed.

source.description: How this message entered the queue

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

created.description: When this message was added to the queue

attempts.description: Maximum delivery attempts before marking as failed

webhookEvents.description: List of event types that will trigger webhook notifications

WebhooksCustomHeaders.description: Additional HTTP headers to include with every webhook request for authentication or tracking

notifyHeaders.description: Email headers to include in webhook payloads for additional context

imapIndexer.description:
IMAP indexing strategy:
  * full - Detect new, changed, and deleted messages (slower but complete)
  * fast - Detect only new messages

all.description: Enable detailed logging for all email accounts

maxLogLines.description: Maximum number of log entries to retain per account

imapStrategy.description: IP address selection strategy for outbound IMAP connections when multiple local addresses are available

smtpStrategy.description: IP address selection strategy for outbound SMTP connections when multiple local addresses are available

localAddresses.description: List of local IP addresses to use for outbound connections (requires appropriate network configuration)

locale.description: Default language/locale for the user interface

webhooksEnabled.description: Enable or disable webhook delivery for all accounts

webhooks.description: Target URL that will receive webhook notifications via POST requests

serviceUrl.description: Base URL of this EmailEngine instance (used for generating public URLs, path component is ignored)

notificationBaseUrl.description: Public callback URL for external OAuth providers. Falls back to serviceUrl if not set

trackClicks.description: Rewrite links in outgoing HTML emails to track click-through rates

trackOpens.description: Insert a tracking pixel in outgoing HTML emails to detect when messages are opened

resolveGmailCategories.description: Automatically detect and categorize Gmail tabs (Primary, Social, Promotions, etc.) for IMAP connections

ignoreMailCertErrors.description: Allow connections to mail servers with self-signed or invalid TLS certificates (not recommended for production)

generateEmailSummary.description: Generate AI-powered summaries for incoming emails using OpenAI

openAiAPIKey.description: Your OpenAI API key for AI features

openAiModel.description: OpenAI model to use for text generation

openAiAPIUrl.description: Base URL for OpenAI API (change for OpenAI-compatible services)

openAiTemperature.description: Controls randomness in AI responses (0 = deterministic, 2 = very creative)

openAiTopP.description: Nucleus sampling parameter for AI text generation (0-1, lower = more focused)

openAiMaxTokens.description: Maximum tokens limit for OpenAI API requests (defaults: GPT-5: 18000, GPT-4: 6500, GPT-3.5: 3000)

openAiPrompt.description: Custom system prompt to guide AI behavior when processing emails
openAiPrompt.example: You are an assistant scanning incoming emails…

openAiGenerateEmbeddings.description: Generate vector embeddings for semantic search and similarity matching

inboxNewOnly.description: Trigger "messageNew" webhooks only for messages arriving in the Inbox folder

serviceSecret.description: HMAC secret for signing API requests and validating webhooks

authServer.description: External authentication service URL for retrieving mailbox credentials dynamically

proxyUrl.description: Proxy server URL for outbound connections

notifyAttachments.description: Include attachment data in webhook payloads

smtpServerEnabled.description: Enable the built-in SMTP server for receiving emails

smtpServerPort.description: Port number for the built-in SMTP server

smtpServerPassword.description: Password for SMTP authentication (null = disable authentication)

smtpServerTLSEnabled.description: Enable TLS/STARTTLS support for the SMTP server

imapProxyServerHost.description: IP address to bind the IMAP proxy to (empty = all interfaces)

imapProxyServerTLSEnabled.description: Enable TLS support for the IMAP proxy

queueKeep.description: Number of completed and failed queue entries to retain for debugging

deliveryAttempts.description: Maximum number of delivery attempts before marking a message as permanently failed

templateHeader.description: Custom HTML to inject at the top of hosted pages (e.g., for branding)

templateHtmlHead.description: Custom HTML to inject into the <head> section of hosted pages (e.g., for analytics)

pageBrandName.description: Brand name displayed in page titles

imapClientVendor.description: Vendor name advertised via IMAP ID extension

imapClientSupportUrl.description: Support URL advertised via IMAP ID extension

connectError.description: Connection failed due to technical error

updated.description: The time this template was last updated

updated.description: The time this route was last updated

targetUrl.description: Target URL that will receive webhook notifications via POST requests

tcount.description: How many times this route has been applied

AccountPath.description: Mailbox folders to monitor for changes (IMAP only). Use "*" to monitor all folders (default). While you can still access unmonitored folders via API, you won't receive webhooks for changes in those folders.

items.description: Mailbox paths to monitor for changes. Use folder names, special-use flags like "\Sent", or "*" for all folders. Set to null to reset to default.

IMAPIndexer.description: Override global IMAP indexing strategy for this account. "full" tracks all changes including deletions, "fast" only detects new messages.

SubconnectionPaths.description: Additional mailbox paths to monitor with dedicated IMAP connections for faster change detection. Use sparingly as connection limits are strict.

accessToken.description: OAuth2 access token (when using OAuth2 instead of password authentication)

Authentication.description: Authentication credentials for the IMAP server

user.description: Username or email address for IMAP authentication

rejectUnauthorized.description: Reject connections to servers with invalid TLS certificates

useAuthServer.description: Use external authentication server to retrieve credentials dynamically

port.description: IMAP server port (typically 993 for IMAP over TLS, 143 for STARTTLS)

secure.description: Use TLS encryption for the connection (true for port 993, false for STARTTLS on port 143)

resyncDelay.description: Delay in seconds between full mailbox resynchronizations

disabled.description: Temporarily disable IMAP operations for this account

sentMailPath.description: Custom folder path for sent messages. Defaults to auto-detected "Sent" folder. Set to null to use default.

draftsMailPath.description: Custom folder path for draft messages. Defaults to auto-detected "Drafts" folder. Set to null to use default.

junkMailPath.description: Custom folder path for spam/junk messages. Defaults to auto-detected "Junk" folder. Set to null to use default.

trashMailPath.description: Custom folder path for deleted messages. Defaults to auto-detected "Trash" folder. Set to null to use default.

archiveMailPath.description: Custom folder path for archived messages. Defaults to auto-detected "Archive" folder. Set to null to use default.

name.description: Display name for the email address

FlagList.description: IMAP flags set on this message

LabelList.description: Gmail labels applied to this message

encodedSize.description: Size of the attachment as stored in the email (base64 encoded). The actual decoded file size is approximately 75% of this value.

embedded.description: Whether the attachment is embedded in the HTML content

inline.description: Whether the attachment should be displayed inline rather than as a download

contentId.description: Content-ID header value used for embedding images in HTML

method.description: Calendar method (REQUEST, REPLY, CANCEL, etc.) for iCalendar attachments

plain.description: Size of the plain text part in bytes

html.description: Size of the HTML part in bytes

id.description: Identifier for fetching the full message text

uid.description: IMAP UID (unique identifier within the mailbox)

emailId.description: Globally unique email identifier (when supported by the email server)

threadId.description: Thread identifier for email conversations (when supported by the email server)

date.description: Date when the message was received by the mail server

draft.description: Whether this message is a draft

inReplyTo.description: Message-ID of the message this is replying to

preview.description: Short preview of the message content

total.description: Total number of messages matching the query (exact for IMAP, approximate for Gmail API)

pages.description: Total number of pages available (exact for IMAP, approximate for Gmail API)

nextPageCursor.description: Cursor for fetching the next page (null when no more pages)

prevPageCursor.description: Cursor for fetching the previous page

MailboxSpecialUse.description: Special folder type (Inbox, Sent, Drafts, etc.)

MailboxSpecialUseSource.description: How the special use was determined: "user" (set via API), "extension" (server-provided), or "name" (guessed from folder name)

unseen.description: Unread message count from STATUS command

delimiter.description: Hierarchy delimiter character used in paths

listed.description: Whether this mailbox appears in LIST command results

subscribed.description: Whether the user is subscribed to this mailbox

noInferiors.description: Whether this mailbox can contain child mailboxes

messages.description: Total number of messages in the mailbox

uidNext.description: Next UID value that will be assigned

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

mainSig.description: Primary DKIM signature. `status.aligned` should be set, otherwise DKIM check should not be considered as passed.

active.description: Jobs that are currently being processed

delayed.description: Jobs that are processed in the future

paused.description: Jobs that would be processed once queue processing is resumed

waiting.description: Jobs that should be processed, but are waiting until there are any free handlers

paused.description: Is the queue paused or not

previewText.description: Preview text shown in email clients after the subject line

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

created.description: The time this template was created

updated.description: The time this template was last updated

maxRequests.description: Maximum requests allowed in the time window

created.description: Was the template created or not

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

action.description: Action type: "reply" (reply to sender), "reply-all" (reply to all recipients), or "forward" (forward to new recipients)

MessageReference.description: Configuration for replying to or forwarding an existing message

message.description: EmailEngine message ID to reply to or forward

inline.description: Include the original message as quoted text in the response

ignoreMissing.description: Continue sending even if the referenced message cannot be found

messageId.description: Verify the Message-ID of the referenced email matches this value before proceeding

Model5.description: Email address with optional display name

name.description: Display name for the email address

reference.description: References an existing attachment by its ID instead of providing new attachment content. If this field is set, the `content` field must not be included. If not set, the `content` field is required.

internalDate.description: Sets the internal date for this message

raw.description: A Base64-encoded email message in RFC 822 format. If you provide other fields along with raw, those fields will override the corresponding values in the raw message.

ResponseReference.description: Reference info if referencing was requested

error.description: An error message if referenced message processing failed

id.description: Unique identifier for the message. NB! This and other fields might not be present if server did not provide enough information

path.description: Folder this message was uploaded to

uidValidity.description: UIDVALIDITY of the target folder. Numeric value cast as string.

MailboxPath.description: Mailbox path as an array or a string. If account is namespaced then namespace prefix is added by default.

EmailIds.description: List of specific email IDs to fetch. When provided, other search criteria are ignored. Useful for bulk operations on known messages.

items.description: Globally unique email identifier (when supported by the email server)

seq.description: Sequence number range (e.g., "1:10" or "1,3,5"). Only supported for IMAP.

answered.description: Filter for messages that have been replied to. Only supported for IMAP.

deleted.description: Filter for messages marked for deletion. Only supported for IMAP.

to.description: Search in To addresses. Not supported for MS Graph API.

cc.description: Search in Cc addresses. Not supported for MS Graph API.

bcc.description: Search in Bcc addresses. Not supported for MS Graph API.

larger.description: Find messages larger than specified size in bytes. Not supported for MS Graph API.

smaller.description: Find messages smaller than specified size in bytes. Not supported for MS Graph API.

uid.description: UID range (e.g., "100:200" or "150,200,250"). Only supported for IMAP.

modseq.description: Find messages with modification sequence higher than specified value. Only supported for IMAP with CONDSTORE.

before.description: Find messages received before this date

since.description: Find messages received after this date

sentBefore.description: Find messages sent before this date

sentSince.description: Find messages sent after this date

emailId.description: Globally unique email identifier (when supported by the email server)

threadId.description: Thread identifier for email conversations (when supported by the email server)

gmailRaw.description: Gmail search syntax (only works with Gmail accounts)

SMTPEnvelope.description: An optional object specifying the SMTP envelope used during email transmission. If not provided, the envelope is automatically derived from the email's message headers. This is useful when you need the envelope addresses to differ from those in the email headers.

ReplyToAddress.description: Email address with optional display name

name.description: Display name for the email address

ToAddress.description: Email address with optional display name

name.description: Display name for the email address

CcAddress.description: Email address with optional display name

name.description: Display name for the email address

BccAddress.description: Email address with optional display name

name.description: Display name for the email address

RenderValues.description: An object of variables for the template renderer

sendAt.description: Send message at specified time. Overrides message level `sendAt` value.

MailMergeList.description: Mail merge options. A separate email is generated for each recipient. Using mail merge disables `messageId`, `envelope`, `to`, `cc`, `bcc`, `render` keys for the message root.

return.description: Specifies if only headers or the entire body of the message should be included in the response (RET)

notify.description: Defines the conditions under which a DSN response should be sent

id.description: The envelope identifier that would be included in the response (ENVID)

recipient.description: The email address the DSN should be sent (ORCPT)

raw.description: A Base64-encoded email message in RFC 822 format. If you provide other fields along with raw, those fields will override the corresponding values in the raw message.

previewText.description: Preview text shown in email clients after the subject line

template.description: Stored template ID to load the email content from

trackOpens.description: Should EmailEngine track opens for this message

trackClicks.description: Should EmailEngine track clicks for this message

copy.description: If set then either copies the message to the Sent Mail folder or not. If not set then uses the account's default setting.

sentMailPath.description: Upload sent message to this folder. By default the account's Sent Mail folder is used.

deliveryAttempts.description: How many delivery attempts to make until message is considered as failed

gateway.description: Optional SMTP gateway ID for message routing

listId.description: List ID for Mail Merge. Must use a subdomain name format. Lists are registered ad-hoc, so a new identifier defines a new list.

baseUrl.description: Optional base URL for trackers. This URL must point to your EmailEngine instance.

proxy.description: Optional proxy URL to use when connecting to the SMTP server

localAddress.description: Optional local IP address to bind to when connecting to the SMTP server

dryRun.description: If true, then EmailEngine does not send the email and returns an RFC822 formatted email file. Tracking information is not added to the email.

Model11.description: Reference info if referencing was requested

success.description: Was the referenced message processed successfully

error.description: An error message if referenced message processing failed

ToAddressSingle.description: Email address with optional display name

name.description: Display name for the email address

Model12.description: Reference info if referencing was requested

success.description: Was the referenced message processed successfully

error.description: An error message if referenced message processing failed

skipped.description: Info about skipped message. If this value is set, then the message was not sent

success.description: Was the referenced message processed successfully

queueId.description: Queue identifier for scheduled email. Not present for bulk messages.

sendAt.description: Send message at specified time. Overrides message level `sendAt` value.

messageId.description: Message-ID header value. Not present for bulk messages.

queueId.description: Queue identifier for scheduled email. Not present for bulk messages.

preview.description: Base64 encoded RFC822 email if a preview was requested

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

deleted.description: Was the address removed from the list

accounts.description: The number of accounts registered with this application. Not available for legacy apps.

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account
Unique identifier for the email account

moved.description: Present if message was moved to Trash

rejectUnauthorized.description: Reject connections to servers with invalid TLS certificates

partial.description: Update only the provided fields instead of replacing the entire configuration

useAuthServer.description: Use external authentication server to retrieve credentials dynamically

secure.description: Use TLS encryption for the connection

resyncDelay.description: Delay in seconds between full mailbox resynchronizations

disabled.description: Temporarily disable IMAP operations for this account

sentMailPath.description: Custom folder path for sent messages. Set to null to use default.

draftsMailPath.description: Custom folder path for draft messages. Set to null to use default.

junkMailPath.description: Custom folder path for spam/junk messages. Set to null to use default.

trashMailPath.description: Custom folder path for deleted messages. Set to null to use default.

archiveMailPath.description: Custom folder path for archived messages. Set to null to use default.

Model16.description: Authentication credentials for the SMTP server

user.description: Username or email address for SMTP authentication

rejectUnauthorized.description: Reject connections to servers with invalid TLS certificates

partial.description: Update only the provided fields instead of replacing the entire configuration

useAuthServer.description: Use external authentication server to retrieve credentials dynamically

secure.description: Use TLS encryption from the start

partial.description: Update only the provided fields instead of replacing the entire configuration

authorize.description: Request an OAuth2 authorization URL instead of directly configuring credentials

provider.description: OAuth2 Application ID configured in EmailEngine

useAuthServer.description: Use external authentication server for token management instead of EmailEngine

accessToken.description: OAuth2 access token for the email account

refreshToken.description: OAuth2 refresh token for obtaining new access tokens

email.description: Default email address of the account

copy.description: Copy submitted messages to Sent folder. Set to `null` to unset and use provider specific default.

notifyFrom.description: Only send webhooks for messages received after this date. Defaults to account creation time. IMAP only.

proxy.description: Proxy server URL for outbound connections

smtpEhloName.description: Hostname to use in SMTP EHLO/HELO commands (defaults to system hostname)

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

clientId.description: Client or Application ID for 3-legged OAuth2 applications

Model20.description: OAuth2 scopes to skip from the base set

serviceClient.description: Service client ID for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

AzureCloud.description: Azure cloud type for Outlook OAuth2 applications

pubSubApp.description: Cloud Pub/Sub app for Gmail API webhooks

googleWorkspaceAccounts.description: Restrict OAuth2 login to Google Workspace accounts only

serviceClientEmail.description: Service Client Email for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

serviceKey.description: PEM formatted service secret for 2-legged OAuth2 applications

authority.description: Authorization tenant value for Outlook OAuth2 applications

flush.description: Only flush the account if true

notifyFrom.description: Only send webhooks for messages received after this date. Defaults to account creation time. IMAP only.

TargetMailboxPath.description: New mailbox path as an array or a string. If account is namespaced then namespace prefix is added by default. Optional.

subscribed.description: Change mailbox subscription status. Only applies to IMAP accounts, ignored for Gmail and Outlook.

newPath.description: Full path to mailbox if renamed

AddFlags.description: Flags to add to the message

DeleteFlags.description: Flags to remove from the message

SetFlags.description: Replace all flags with this list

AddLabels.description: Gmail labels to add (use label ID or path)

DeleteLabels.description: Gmail labels to remove (use label ID or path)

secure.description: Should connection use TLS. Usually true for port 465

paused.description: Is the queue paused or not

previewText.description: Preview text shown in email clients after the subject line

updated.description: Was the template updated or not

account.description: Unique identifier for the email account

IdMapArray.description: An optional map of source and target ID values, if the server provided this info

EmailIdsArray.description: An optional list of emailId values, if the server supports unique email IDs

MessagesMovedToTrash.description: Value is present if messages were moved to Trash

source.description: Source mailbox folder path (Gmail API only). Needed to remove the label from the message.

id.description: ID of the moved message. Only included if the server provides it.

uid.description: UID of the moved message, applies only to IMAP accounts. Only included if the server provides it.

parameters.name: path

schema.description: Mailbox folder path. Can use special use labels like "\Sent". Special value "\All" is available for Gmail IMAP, Gmail API, MS Graph API accounts.

parameters.description: Mailbox folder path. Can use special use labels like "\Sent". Special value "\All" is available for Gmail IMAP, Gmail API, MS Graph API accounts.

parameters.name: cursor

schema.description: Paging cursor from `nextPageCursor` or `prevPageCursor` value

parameters.description: Paging cursor from `nextPageCursor` or `prevPageCursor` value

parameters.name: page

schema.description: Page number (zero-indexed, so use 0 for the first page). Only supported for IMAP accounts. Deprecated; use the paging cursor instead. If the page cursor value is provided, then the page number value is ignored.

parameters.description: Page number (zero-indexed, so use 0 for the first page). Only supported for IMAP accounts. Deprecated; use the paging cursor instead. If the page cursor value is provided, then the page number value is ignored.

parameters.name: pageSize

schema.description: How many entries per page

parameters.description: How many entries per page

parameters.name: useOutlookSearch

schema.description: MS Graph only. If enabled, uses the $search parameter for MS Graph search queries instead of $filter. This allows searching the "to", "cc", "bcc", "larger", "smaller", "body", "before", "sentBefore", "since", and the "sentSince" fields. Note that $search returns up to 1,000 results, does not indicate the total number of matching results or pages, and returns results sorted by relevance rather than date.

parameters.description: MS Graph only. If enabled, uses the $search parameter for MS Graph search queries instead of $filter. This allows searching the "to", "cc", "bcc", "larger", "smaller", "body", "before", "sentBefore", "since", and the "sentSince" fields. Note that $search returns up to 1,000 results, does not indicate the total number of matching results or pages, and returns results sorted by relevance rather than date.

post.description: Submit message for delivery. If reference message ID is provided then EmailEngine adds all headers and flags required for a reply/forward automatically.

schema.description: For MS Graph accounts: If true, uses structured JSON format (respects from field for shared mailboxes, breaks calendar invites and special MIME types). If false, sends as raw MIME (preserves calendar invites, ignores from field). Default is false (raw MIME).

parameters.description: For MS Graph accounts: If true, uses structured JSON format (respects from field for shared mailboxes, breaks calendar invites and special MIME types). If false, sends as raw MIME (preserves calendar invites, ignores from field). Default is false (raw MIME).
